item.title: Within bus stop markings, 26th March
item.description:
Roughly opposite Treelands Drive, Leckhampton
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: When is road being reopened?, 26th March
item.description:
Closing this road and not mending it has increased the traffic on an already busy road(badgeworth Road). It is also meaning that we have to use the more dangerous The Reddings to access our house as turning right is very difficult due to the hedge blocking sight of the road. I have had many frights as so difficult to see. Also cars turning right into The Reddings cut the corner and accidents have happened.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 26th March
item.description:
there are two sign posts that look like they should have a sign on them, but the sign is missing. Google StreetView suggests the poles have been without their sign since at least 2009, so if the signage is not going to be replaced it might be worth removing them.
Report on FixMyStreet
